meanings.definition: Make forceful or violent efforts to get free of restraint or constriction.
meanings.sent1: The cat tried to struggle out of the box.
meanings.sent2: She struggled to open the jammed door.
meanings.sent3: The pickle jar struggled to open itself.
meanings.sent4: The butterfly struggled to break free from its cocoon.
meanings.sent5: The fish struggled against the hook, trying to escape.

meanings.definition: Engage in conflict or competition with.
meanings.sent1: The two teams will struggle for victory in the final match.
meanings.sent2: Countries often struggle for control over valuable resources.
meanings.sent3: The siblings struggled in a fierce game of chess.
meanings.sent4: The candidates will struggle for votes in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent5: The animals struggle for dominance in the jungle.

meanings.definition: Have difficulty handling or coping with.
meanings.sent1: She struggles with her math homework every night.
meanings.sent2: He struggles to understand the complex instructions.
meanings.sent3: The robot struggles to comprehend human emotions.
meanings.sent4: The plant struggles to survive in the harsh desert climate.
meanings.sent5: The child struggles with tying shoelaces.
